What I'm Learning This Week:

  • JavaScript, more JavaScript, & even more JavaScript
  • CSS Preprocessing (Sass).

What I'm Reading This Week:

  • David Flanagan, JavaScript: The Definitive Guide

What I'm Watching This Week:

  • Kes
  • The Last-Drive In, S03E06

This Week's Hot Track:

Built To Spill, "Else"

This Week's Hot Laugh:

Upright Citizens Brigade's Bug Juice Sketch

"Un site est jamais achevé — c’est toujours un accident qui le termine, c’est à dire qui le donne au public. Ce sont la lassitude, la demande de l’utilisateur, la poussée d’un autre site. Mais jamais l’état même de l’ouvrage (si le concepteur n’est pas un sot) ne montre qu’il ne pourrait être poussé, changé, considéré comme première approximation, ou origine d’une recherche nouvelle. Je conçois, quant à moi, que le même site et presque le même code pourraient être repris indéfiniment et occuper toute une vie. 'Perfection' c’est travail."

Paul Valéry Œuvres

Hello! My name is Larry.

I make websites.

Click here to test this site's performance using Google's PageSpeed Insights.

I've been working as a front-end web developer for about three years now. I love it! Building things that both delight users and help them find & do things on the World Wide Web is immensely fulfilling.

This is my personal website.

I'm an unapologetic '90s kid who (fondly) remembers GeoCities, LambdaMOO, and many other cultural artifacts of the Internet's dial-up days; and I've tried to incorporate those memories into this site's overall look & feel. This is purely a matter of personal taste and, though I hope it goes without saying, my aesthetic choices reflect what I happen to like. If I were building any other kind of a site, especially for a client or employer, it would look very different! (If you want to see some examples of what "very different" looks like, check out the My Work section of this site, linked below.)

NAV INSTRUCTIONS:This website is organized into different sections. You can visit (& learn more about) each section using the cards below. To navigate to an individual card, click on one of the short links below or manually scroll down.

My Web Dev JourneyMy WorkWeb Dev Learning ResourcesWhat I UseSnippetsCSS LabJavaScript LabCoding Rules & AssumptionsING SystemPolymathyThe Conspiracy Against LarryPersonal Rules & AssumptionsCommonplace Book

My Web Dev Journey

I wasn't always a web developer. It took me a while to get here, and I learned a lot of valuable things along the way I'd love to share with you.

My Work

My professional work & side projects can all be found here, as well as my resume & other material I've created to help HR professionals (or anyone else dragooned into HR-related work) get a better sense of who I am, what I know, how I add value, & how I can help organizations reach their goals.

Available For Hire!

Web Dev Learning Resources

The best web devs are constantly pushing themselves to learn new things, including new things about what they "already" know. Without the right tools, resources, methods, & techniques, that can be incredibly (and needlessly) challenging. Here you can find the resources are I used to teach myself web development, as well the resources I use to continue building out of my knowledge as a web developer.

What I Use

A semi-exhaustive rundown of the tools, applications, & systems I lean on to help me make get the most out of my day-to-day work. This section also provides details on tools I'm using on a trial basis, tools I intend to try in the not-too-distant future, and "legacy" tools I no longer use. Real nerd stuff.

Snippets

A collection of somewhat useful, always interesting smaller-than-a-bread-box-sized chunks of code I've created, adapted, or gently tweaked to help me tackle specific problems or respond to specific use cases.
